467856c2-7fa9-40c1-86f4-3e56739ce60e.description: Students who receive this badge will understand the University of Pittsburgh Academic Integrity policies, identify common types of plagiarism, and create appropriate paraphrases of materials they have read.
467856c2-7fa9-40c1-86f4-3e56739ce60e.name: Academic Integrity

badge_template_activities.title: Engage with interactive content with embedded activities.
Pass quizzes that test knowledge on academic integrity, plagiarism, and paraphrasing.

ac9d5979-829e-4ade-82df-eb6dc265ecd2.description: Earners of this micro-credential have demonstrated competency in pharmacogenomics concepts and their application in clinical practice. They are able to make appropriate recommendations for pharmacogenomics testing, interpret results, integrate these data into patient care decision, counsel patients, and collaboration with prescribers to help optimize patient medication regimens.
ac9d5979-829e-4ade-82df-eb6dc265ecd2.name: Certificate in Pharmacogenomics

alignments.name: Genetics / Genomics Competency Center
alignments.description: Program fulfils competency standards for pharmacists

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 12 hours of self-paced home study involving online videos and readings.
Achieved a minimum 80% score on 11 individual assessments
Actively participated interactive discussion and exercises using real genetic data.

Successfully completed five competency checks to demonstrate they can predict phenotypes from genetic data, leverage online information resources, apply pharmacogenomics clinical decision making skills, communicate with patients and providers, and apply core components of the Pharmacists’ Patient Care Process to design a clinical PGx service.

ffe1970c-4c58-4f0c-9a72-a3b002cdb206.description: This self-paced course is an interprofessional, competency-based certificate program designed to educate both student and practicing pharmacists on how to recognize, screen, intervene, and refer patients with hearing loss.
ffe1970c-4c58-4f0c-9a72-a3b002cdb206.name: CHAMP: Championing Hearing Using Accessible Medication Experts at the Community Pharmacy

alignments.name: Course Competencies
alignments.description: Program fulfils competency standards for pharmacists

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will receive badge upon completion of two diagnostic exams and 9 to 10 quizzes demonstrating learning competencies.

8401dfbe-a1c6-4f90-9ee7-c6fe0c1f7b26.description: In this Graduate Student Teaching Initiative program, participants attend six or more teaching workshops within three concentrations (Pedagogy, Professional Development, Educational Technology, Online Teaching, Diversity/Equity/Inclusion), and submit corresponding assignments meeting best practices criteria, as determined by University Center for Teaching and Learning staff. The final requirement is a capstone essay, describing the impact of the program on participants' teaching.
8401dfbe-a1c6-4f90-9ee7-c6fe0c1f7b26.name: Achievement in Pedagogy

badge_template_activities.title: Competencies associated with each workshop within the program are evaluated according to a 5-point rubric, with criteria varying by each assignment. A document summarizing the specific competencies met by the awardee is attached.

68284358-f944-4f05-bd8b-c5c1f8750b38.description: The Foundations for Success: Healthcare Leadership and Business Fundamentals Series equips healthcare emerging and advancing leaders with foundational business, leadership, and team development skills. Participants refine their competency in collaboration, teamwork and conflict management. Individuals emerge from the program with an enhanced understanding of finance, accounting, operations and marketing, discovering how these areas work together to promote an efficient healthcare system.
68284358-f944-4f05-bd8b-c5c1f8750b38.name: Foundations for Success: Healthcare Leadership and Business Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the required activities in each of the three modules in Canvas. These activities include instructor-led videos, comprehension checks, reflections, self-assessments, take-action activities and readings.
Each module ends with a synchronous remote panel that includes leaders in the healthcare industry. Students must attend or view the recordings of each panel (3).
The series will conclude with a final capstone remote session. Students must attend or view the recording of the final capstone session.

8beeefd2-3c02-4fb7-8e89-2821e2659c12.description: Learn the fundamentals of securing data, systems, and networks. You will describe key security challenges in computer systems and networks and understand how to address them using cybersecurity techniques and best practices; recognize the ways risks manifest in enterprise networks and how to apply risk management techniques like vulnerability scanning and penetration testing; and understand how information privacy and data ownership affect the ways data must be stored, accessed, and curated.
8beeefd2-3c02-4fb7-8e89-2821e2659c12.name: Introduction to Information Security and Privacy

badge_template_activities.title: Students review lecture content and supplemental materials, and participate in discussion with classmates about the content.
Students complete module quizzes and a final exam.
Students apply knowledge learned through course content to hands-on labs.

1ec32bd8-6de2-4924-8b73-0d18727d808f.description: You will create secure network architectures, identify vulnerabilities in network defenses, apply network defense tools and techniques, and determine and implement appropriate network security protocols on a given network. This course is for students with some background in networking who want to move into cyber security or who want to be able to secure the networks they work with.
1ec32bd8-6de2-4924-8b73-0d18727d808f.name: Network Security

badge_template_activities.title: Students review lecture content and supplemental materials, and participate in discussion with classmates about the content.
Students will take a final exam.
Students apply knowledge learned through course content to hands-on labs.

f2860237-5969-424e-a153-c9d4fed7e8c9.description: This is the first of two courses in our Offensive Boot Camp series. A variety of tools and techniques are presented that are fundamental to today’s offensive security professionals. The coursework is designed to be hands on, with students expected to apply techniques in a lab setting after discussing in a lecture format. The skills presented can be used immediately on the job to build the skillset of a junior penetration tester or junior red team professional.
f2860237-5969-424e-a153-c9d4fed7e8c9.name: Offensive Boot Camp Part I: Understanding Vulnerabilities & Exploits

badge_template_activities.title: Students learn through online video as well as face-to-face lectures highlighting offensive cybersecurity tools & techniques, and discussions with instructor and classmates.

Students must demonstrate their skills though a final exam networked lab environment where they must demonstrate attack tactics and break vulnerable machines.  Their discoveries are documented in a final exam report.

Students are presented with a variety of structured labs to reinforce lecture materials.  In addition, an unstructured lab environment with vulnerable machines is presented for students to work on their skills, prior to attempting the final exam environment.

2fe972f0-b191-4af5-bc3c-13a81fa70add.description: By the end of this course, students will have developed a basic understanding of government oversight of the handling of sensitive personal information, learned about the legal issues pertaining to information security, be able to recognize government agencies that play a vital part in overseeing cybersecurity and data protection, and will know the necessary steps to be taken in the event of a data breach and the likely liabilities associated with such a breach.
2fe972f0-b191-4af5-bc3c-13a81fa70add.name: Cybersecurity, Privacy & Regulations

badge_template_activities.title: Students need to pass the course Cybersecurity, Privacy, and Regulations to earn this badge.

eca31b61-e6c6-43ea-a565-1f6643b1b14a.description: The Boot Camp for Non-tech Professionals provides professionals with a non-tech background the technical skills they need to pursue cybersecurity education and eventually enter the field. This course teaches students about virtualization, the basics of computer networking, terminal and command line interfaces, and more.
eca31b61-e6c6-43ea-a565-1f6643b1b14a.name: Boot Camp for Non-tech Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Students must pass this course with 75% or higher on all assignments.

2a7a53e5-cd90-4460-b24e-47f279b7f2bd.description: Thirty hours of study in the required education on prevention, early intervention, and treatment of problematic and disordered gambling for individuals and families. The program meets training and education criteria for International Gambling Counselor Certification, known as the ICGC-I. This program also provides three hours of ethics and one hour of suicide training through the lens of problem gambling, also known as the hidden addiction.
2a7a53e5-cd90-4460-b24e-47f279b7f2bd.name: Problem Gambling

badge_template_activities.title: Participants who earn this achievement have completed this 18-module, self-paced course that delivers lessons through lectures, videos, and experiential assignments and activities and is prepared to further their knowledge through their ICGC-I Certification. They have passed 18 quizzes at the end of each module designed to test their knowledge in these areas of practice. Additionally, they have completed 8 activities and up to 15 assignments as part of this micro credential program.

858e80c4-834a-483d-9fef-d00caafc7590.description: This badge is to certify the achievements in the pharmacometrics workshop developed by the University of Pittsburgh, Buffalo, and Indiana. The attendees demonstrated knowledge in each area by completing daily milestones as well as a comprehensive course project.
858e80c4-834a-483d-9fef-d00caafc7590.name: Achievement in Pharmacometrics

badge_template_activities.title: Achieving greater than or equal to 80% in Day 1 Assignment
Achieving greater than or equal to 80% on the Final Project

5471a573-b44b-4817-af8f-be2c69fff2af.description: Vulnerabilities, Threats, and Attacks addresses the different classes of vulnerabilities and demonstrates how these vulnerabilities can be used in the various stages of an attack. Students analyze case studies, frameworks and assessments to develop an understanding of how threats are modeled and how attacks can be mitigated.
5471a573-b44b-4817-af8f-be2c69fff2af.name: Vulnerabilities, Threats, and Attacks

badge_template_activities.title: Students must engage in discussion of course topics with participation on peers' posts.
Students must demonstrate their skills and knowledge though a final exam and achieve 80%.
Students must demonstrate their knowledge in five quizzes.

11a486d5-6f58-4c4b-8d06-f934030d4763.description: Learners will compare the instructor's role and different aspects of a structured course in face-to-face and online learning. This program will teach instructional design strategies to engage learners, methods for orienting learners to online learning. practices for facilitating online discussions. The course also teaches software application with Panopto and Canvas. A focus will be on collaboration with an instructional designer.
11a486d5-6f58-4c4b-8d06-f934030d4763.name: Online Instruction

badge_template_activities.title: Quiz: Preparation for Course Design and Development Quiz
Quiz: Designing Activities and Instructional Materials Quiz

78d620a7-7922-48d3-a011-d2abad099f39.description: The Mentoring Academy, sponsored by the Center for Mentoring at the University of Pittsburgh, offers a series of interactive sessions devoted to helping faculty, postdoctoral fellows, and graduate students develop skills in eight mentoring competency areas, based upon curriculum developed by the Center for the Improvement of Mentored Experiences in Research (CIMER). The course is seven contact hours over one to two semesters.
78d620a7-7922-48d3-a011-d2abad099f39.name: The Mentoring Academy

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attend a series of interactive workshops and demonstrate competencies by the conclusion of each workshop.

ac21bc9a-159e-4e4b-8d03-cc7594347f5c.description: Learners will select appropriate assignment types, align assignments to learning objectives, and write clear, engaging assignment prompts. Focus will be given to instructional alignment of assessments, objectives, and learning activities. Types of assessments will be explored: formative and summative; self-assessment; traditional and alternative; peer-to-peer; online discussion participation. Effective rubric design will be covered.
ac21bc9a-159e-4e4b-8d03-cc7594347f5c.name: Assessment

badge_template_activities.title: Quiz: Designing Assignments
Quiz: Rubrics and Feedback Quiz
Quiz: Assessment in Online Courses

783971a0-9af6-440d-8c0f-41e49b8f22fd.description: Offensive Boot Camp II: Penetration Testing gives students hands-on experience in all phases of the Cyber Kill Chain, from breaching a network and gaining a foothold to utilizing command-and-control (C2) frameworks to move laterally to other targets on a network and gain persistence.
783971a0-9af6-440d-8c0f-41e49b8f22fd.name: Offensive Boot Camp II: Penetration Testing

badge_template_activities.title: Students must pass the course Offensive Boot Camp II: Penetration Testing to earn this badge.

ae050e9b-6cad-454c-bca1-991f883bddc7.description: Lerners will recognize accessibility barriers and the services available to support students with disabilities. The course will promote methods, materials, and assessments that are effective and accessible for students with various types of disabilities. Principles of multimedia design will be explored. The Open Educational Resources movement will also be discussed. The program will compel faculty to apply a proactive approach to inclusive learning and accommodations.
ae050e9b-6cad-454c-bca1-991f883bddc7.name: Universal Design Concepts

badge_template_activities.title: Quiz: Developing an Accessible Course
Open Educational Resources Assignment

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

5ca08959-32b9-42a0-b2c0-a5a3151e8ea6.description: Faculty who earn the gamification badge have demonstrated their ability to significantly revise a course activities and assessments to incorporate gamified learning experiences to enhance teaching, learning, and engagement.
5ca08959-32b9-42a0-b2c0-a5a3151e8ea6.name: Gamification

badge_template_activities.title: Creating Gamified Learning Experiences: Participants will attend a 1.5 hour workshop co-presented by the Teaching Center and the Center for Creativity to learn foundational concepts about gamified learning and the collaborate with colleagues to begin to strategize their gamification goals and how to incorporate gamified experiences into one of their courses.

Exploring Campus Resources: Participants will either explore one of the campus maker spaces (the Center for Creativity workshop, Text and conText lab, OpenLab@Alumni, OpenLab@Hillman) or meet for a consultation with a teaching consultant, librarian, or Center for Creativity staff member to identify resources to support their gamification goals.

Submit Revised Course Materials: Participants will submit the course materials that they revised (e.g. syllabus, assignments, presentations, and/or Canvas course shell) demonstrating how they revised one course to incorporate gamified learning experiences. They will also submit a short narrative statement explaining changes and how they intend to assess the impact of those changes.

9102529c-f205-4030-9447-f2dcab743fa8.description: Fifteen hours of study in the Motivational Interviewing Introductory and Intermediate course. This individual will have proven that they have extensive knowledge of motivational interviewing in the social work field. The badge indicates that a social worker who has earned this badge has the knowledge and skill development necessary to provide effective motivational interviewing skills in the individual's social work practice.
9102529c-f205-4030-9447-f2dcab743fa8.name: Motivational Interviewing

badge_template_activities.title: The following individual must complete all modules, assignments, and reflection exercises in the Motivational interviewing course in order to receive a digital badge for the program.

0f290c8b-53b2-47b9-9e2d-96ec9b21eb8a.description: This badge represents modules, activities, and reflection exercises included in the 25-hour course, including one hour of suicide prevention. After completing the course, the individual will prove that they have exposed themselves to an extensive amount of knowledge and resources on systemic racism and racial trauma. The badge indicates that the individual will have a better understanding of the subject matter and can apply it to their practice or work.
0f290c8b-53b2-47b9-9e2d-96ec9b21eb8a.name: Understanding Systemic Racism & Healing Racial Trauma

badge_template_activities.title: The individual must complete all modules, readings, videos, assignments, and reflection exercises in the Understanding Systemic Racism & Healing Racial Trauma course in order to receive a digital badge for the program.

78a8e6da-6fee-4f97-b8c7-c56eecd975d5.description: Twenty hours of study in the LCSW Supervision Institute course. This individual will have proven that they have extensive knowledge of clinical supervision in the social work field. The badge indicates that a licensed clinical social worker who has earned this badge has the knowledge and skill development necessary to provide effective clinical supervision to licensed social workers in the state of PA.
78a8e6da-6fee-4f97-b8c7-c56eecd975d5.name: LCSW Supervision Training Institute

badge_template_activities.title: The following individual must complete all modules, assignments, and reflection exercises in the LCSW Supervision Training Institute course in order to receive a digital badge for the program.

51a10b6d-e54a-406a-a7ca-2e7cb75fe0fc.description: Completion of this course signifies training in Infant and Early Childhood Mental Health. Students will show improved knowledge and capacity for supporting social-emotional development of very young children.
51a10b6d-e54a-406a-a7ca-2e7cb75fe0fc.name: Infant Mental Health

badge_template_activities.title: The Infant Mental Health online course requires an 80% mastery threshold to complete each module. Learning materials offer reflective exercises and case studies with sample answers, and the student is assessed with quizzes.

180bf228-a2b7-4f7d-8582-b77b841d32f6.description: The badge is awarded from the Department of Bioengineering at the Swanson School of Engineering. The individual will have the experience to prepare for and teach lectures in STEM fields.
180bf228-a2b7-4f7d-8582-b77b841d32f6.name: Teaching Practicum Experience

badge_template_activities.title: The graduate student must complete two teaching practicums. There is no course registration for the practicums. Fulfillment is monitored at departmental level.

Complete “Associate” level certification through Pitt-CIRTL. This requires the student to: a. enroll in and satisfactorily complete ENGR 3001 or equivalent 1-credit course that prepares for teaching in the STEM classroom, b. create a teaching philosophy statement, and attend two online CIRTL Network one-hour seminar events.
